title: DPM apprises French Minister of Pakistan’s restrained response in self-defense against Indian aggression
content:
ISLAMABAD, May 12 (APP):Deputy Prime Minister/Foreign Minister (DPM/FM), Senator Mohammad Ishaq Dar on Monday held a telephonic conversation with the Minister for Europe and Foreign Affairs of France, Jean-Noël Barrot.
The DPM/FM informed that Pakistan had shown restraint throughout the crisis and only exercised its right to self-defense, in line with the UN Charter and international law, a DPM’s Office news release said.
Dar said, “Pakistan would continue to work in a responsible manner for maintaining regional peace and security.”
FM Jean-Noël Barrot conveyed condolences over the loss of innocent lives. Welcoming the ceasefire understanding between Pakistan and India, he emphasized the need for both sides to exercise restraint.
Both leaders agreed to maintain close contact, including through multilateral fora.
